Reviews.Title: “good location, very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelBOYPortugal
Reviews.Content: Great location, 3 min walk from termini station great with train, subway, buses... and you can get many cultural places walking 15 min. In the hotel, the staff are very friendly, rooms small but with large beds and modern bathrooms, as shown in the photos of the site. Breakfast very good with fresh fruit, offer much ... served in a beautiful all-glass room, a rooftop overlooking to the city. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Simple , clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: bilbel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of march for 3 nights. The location is very convient if you are travelling into rome from the airport by train as it is approx 3 mins walk from the station. Check in was very easy , staff very friendly and made us feel very welcome providing us with a map and pointing out the location of the hotel. We stayed in a corner room on 3rd floor so had 2 windows in our room each on a different street, was a little noisy if u had the windows open in the morning but not so much at night. We ate the first night in pizza familglia on the side street next to the hotel. This place was ok but the service left a little to be desired , we were served our food very quickly we were in and out in about 35 mins .. We prefer to savor a meal and take our time and a smile costs nothing either. 2nd night we ate in an italian approx 1 min walk twrds the station this was very nice and staff were friendly (even gave me a glass of vino on the house at the end of the meal). 3rd night we took a taxi (which reception kindly called for us) to the pantheon which was €9 and ate in one of the many resturants down the side streets near the pantheon. We then saved just enough room and visited della palma ice cream and chocolate shop. This shop is an ice cream lovers dream many many flavors to choose from and will cost €4 for a chocolate cone with 3 scoops ... very reasonable prices as we paid €5 for an ice cream not nearly as nice near the spanish steps. I was very pleased with the hotel and would stay here again if i return to rome... well i did throw me coin in the trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great breakfast, good room”
Reviews.Author: George N
Reviews.Content: The best attributes of this hotel are the friendly, English speaking staff, the excellent breakfast and the location. The hotel is located just a few blocks from Roma Termini, along the Via Volturna, though you’ll need to look carefully to find it. There is no large sign above the building, just two small gold colored plaques on the wall. It’s an easy walk, even if you have a lot of luggage. Once you’ve dumped that luggage off, you are right around the corner from several decent restaurants and a couple of nice churches, including the Santa Maria Vittoria, the one with Bernini’s St. Teresa sculpture. The Termini Metro stop is at Roma Termini, so you are very close to the Metro too. A couple of stops from that is the Colosseum and a few more on another line is Vatican City. The second great part about this hotel is the breakfast. This is no skimpy breakfast, but a full buffet, which will prepare you well for touring the city. Finally, the staff is excellent. All speak English, some exceptionally so. They were great at recommending places to visit. Our rate was reasonable, 100 Euros for a triple, but that was in low season. There are a few negatives, one being the size of the rooms, they are definitely on the smallish side, though the bathrooms are large. The wood tile floor in ours had some water damage at some point in the past, so it was loose and peeling in a few places. It would be nice if they got around to fixing that. Other than that, this hotel is good to come home to after a long day running around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with low price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Delenna
Reviews.Content: I & my husband spent 3 nights in Eurostars Domus Aurea in Rome. The location is perfect for those using the railway (and many people take the train from the airport) as it's really close to Termini station. The front desk personel were professional and when we arrived they gave us a map of Rome, marking the hotel on it - without asking. The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious. The bed was so big there wasn't much room left but it was totally fine for us. There was a closet, table, tv and mini-bar. In the closet there's a safe - you get the key from the front desk by paying a 20 euro deposit (which was returned when we returned the key). There was a heating system which worked even we were there when it snowed for the first time in 27 years :) After we returned from a day in the city the air was a bit damp though but that was fixed with keeping the window open for a few minutes. Breakfast was served on the 6th floor with a view over the rooftops. The breakfast was simple buut there was enough choises. The hot chocolate is really awesome - it's like melted chocolate, nothing like we get in Finland (here it's water/milk based thin liquid). Even the cleaning personnel greeted us (in italian) when passed by :) And we saw italian guests in this hotel as well! The hotel is within walking distance (at least to us) from the sights. No noise problems. Would definitely recommed this! And would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: bedike
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit hard to find but it's in excellent location to Termini station, which is a transport hub. Also, airport shuttles stop here, so no need for cabs to get to the hotel from the airport. The room we had was quite small, but for a long weekend it is ample size. The room was clen, plenty of towels provided and toiletries replenished daily. THe hotel is on a busy road, but has good windows, no noise comes in. Tips: there is a pizza place down the road (not towards the station, but the other way) on the other side of the road, perfect for cheap pizza, massive kebabs and coffee. Try to get refreshments etc in the station downstairs there is a cheap supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: seniorOE
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel very recently on the last weekend of January 2012. This smallish hotel is very well situated to the Roma Termini station; just exit the right side entrance, and turn left and walk along Via Marsala - after the crossing, it's Via Volturno. Less than 10 minute walk. The moment we stepped into the lobby, we were warmly welcome by the receptionist (Flamina) who spoke excellent English, was courteous, friendly, quick and extremely efficient. We requested to put our passports in the reception safe and store our bag whilst we got back to the station to get on the trambus for a quick orientation of Rome. She gave us a receipt for both items, a brochure and a map and marked the hotel location, without being asked. She also asked if we wanted twin beds as we had booked a double, so thoughtful! The room itself was quiet, super clean (great cleaning staff who were also very courteous ), adequate (we did not find it too small, but then we are not big size or overweight), and had a nice shower, bidet, towels and all accessories. However there was one big drawback - our room was very stuffy, the air conditioner seemed to just be blowing dry air, no matter how we adjusted the controls. Eventually we had to get up from bed and open the windows - immediately the street noise and air pollution got into the room, so we left the windows slightly ajar. My bed also creaked at the slightest movement but not my daughter's - this wasn't a big problem as I am a quiet sleeper. I would rate the hotel Excellent if not for this. If there's one thing that the staff themselves can improve on, it would be that they try to be as knowledgeable about other products besides the ones they are promoting, e.g. Open 110 trambus which was great value for money as it was only 25 Euros for 72 hours for both the green country as well as the red city tour buses. It was also the last Sunday of the month the following day which means that the Vatican museums were free which we found out when we got there, if this wast mentioned when I requested for information about visiting the Vatican, it would just be fabulous. So, great staff who are a credit to the hotel and good, clean facilities. Overall a good stay - would have been better if air conditioner was pre-checked thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but OK in everything else”
Reviews.Author: Marcel0G
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the Termini area, OK. Unusually good breakfast. Clean rooms. This is Rome, so there is no space.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaB2
Reviews.Content: We spent five days there just last week,December 17-22, and we really enjoyed it! there were four of us: husband and I, and two children. What I liked the most: very friendly and helpful staff, they would answer any question, very patient. Rooms were made every day, we had no shortage of any supplies: bathroom is equipped with all necessary. FYI: there are no tea,coffee facilities in the room, no bathrobe, no slippers. Floors are something like laminate, so not really cold or slippery. In general the room was quite warm, and the windows open fully. Big comfortable bed, side tables, writing desk, some stationery. The downside is- the size of the room! It's really small! Had a good substantial breakfast every morning, a good variety, all freshly made. Location is great, just a few minutes walk from Termini station: metro, buses, trains- all are there. Plus very close to some major attractions. Just around the corner a very good Italian restaurant recommended by Antonio.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - serves a gluten free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: GlutenFreeWife
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Rome for 3 nights during the first week of November and we stayed at the Eurostar Domus Aurea Hotel. The location of the hotel is great, its about 200m from the Termini Station so it's perfect to get around. All the major attractions of Rome are within a 10/15 mins walk from the hotel. We walked everywhere which is the best way to see Rome, however make sure you take a good pair of walking shoes as your feet will hurt otherwise! The rooms are quite small but they are very clean and tidy - which is all you need really. Plus if your going to Rome your not going to be spending much time in your room other than sleeping so it doesn't matter if it's small. The beds are very comfy which is great after a long day sightseeing, however the walls are quite thin so you can hear a lot of noise from the other guests. The breakfast is good but make sure you get there early so you can have hot fresh food. They also provided a gluten free breakfast for my husband due to his allergies, which was excellent. If you have to follow a gluten free diet then you'll be fine in Rome as most restaurants are aware of it and some even provide gluten free pasta. Just make sure you ask. We visited all the major attractions whilst we were in Rome, and here's a few tips from what we learnt: 1) The Vatican Museums - it will cost about 12 euro each if you do this yourself, but it's well worth it to get a guided tour. This will cost about 40 euro each and you'll need to make sure you get a good tour guide. Also we found out that on the last Sunday of every month it's free to get in. You can also go to the top of St Peters Basilica for an extra 5 euro each. 2) Colussem & Roman Forum - it will cost about 12 euro each if you do it this yourself and about 25 euro each if you get a guided tour. I don't think it's worth having a guided tour here though. 3) All the other attractions are free so you can take your time exploring these. Overall, Rome is a great place to visit and we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJcoolmom
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed staying here for 4 nights..nice, clean and friendly staff.. Only one complain Breakfast was horrible! Only get a room and you can find bakery or restaurants nearby and much cheaper and better.. wifi is fast and all around hotel! I am not a big fan of location..after 8 pm. Is dead!! I would stay closer to spanish step area.. Lots of things to do and eat:)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms small”
Reviews.Author: majellamaryquinn
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small bit disappointed but staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: donald m
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a good basic, no frills Hotel. We chose it because of the close proximity to the train station. Nice roof top breakfast area, although we chose to sit on the small outside area, rather than be cooped up in the enclosed area because the weather was so nice. Rooms are adequate, but small which is too be expected in a Hotel of this rating. Staff was helpful and checking in and out was efficient and friendly. There are several nice little restaurants in the area and a small little bar across the street for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cxahmed
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but has very small rooms with thin walls so you can hear whatever they are saying in the next room. The breakfast is on the roof and is very good. The hotel is near the train station. Many restaurants around it. But again the rooms are tiny. This hotel defines what a tiny room is. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: Claudiu79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Termini and Repubblica metro stations, easy to reach on foot. The restaurant on top floor has a nice view over the city, the breakfast menu is complete. The bad part is about the rooms, are very small, with a little bathroom and some of them are on street side and might be noisy during night. For those arriving too early the hotel offers a luggage room so you can leave your suitcases till your room is cleaned (usually after 2 PM). City maps can be found at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xCharlottex1
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel located close to the train station. There is a bus that brings you to the train station from the airport so it is conveniently located. The front desk staff was most pleasant and very helpful in givng directions. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was the best we had in Italy. The dining roomis on the roof tops so it was breaksfast with a view every morning......loved it. I would definitely recomend this hotel and certainly would use it again. Al and Charlotte Lawrence

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it to most travellers”
Reviews.Author: sue-brisbane-aust
Reviews.Content: Location is superb - walking distance from train station with suitcases in a safe area. Breakfast offers enough choices but could become repetitive if there for a long period. The room is small - but no smaller than most of Europe. We were mother/adult daughter and had enough room. Every staff member was extremely helpful and courteous to us. Would certainly recommend it as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Rowthehousedown
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, but after being in youth hostels all around Europe, we were happy to spend the same amount and be in an air-conditioned (summer), clean room with a good bathroom. Breakfast was very cute (on the roof) with a smiling waiter (even though the concierge did not pay much attention to us). The concierge recommended us a TERRIBLE restaurant however, which dampened our spirits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: tour_on1
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 8 pm by train and it was very close and easy to. Walk to even with our luggage. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were great and lots to choose from. It was nice and close to all the sites and if you like walking you could walk to everything

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine242
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to most of the sites. Close to Roma termini station and the metro. Short distance to the On/off bus stops. The staff are fabulous. Breakfast is on rooftop and has a wide variety of choices. Room is clean and a standard size for Europe. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: aquarius1961
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Thursday 2nd June 2011. The staff were very professional and they made us feel very welcome straightaway. The room was very clean and our breakfast was delightful. The roof-top garden where the beakfast is held is quite stunning and has a lovely atmosphere. We were most pleased with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- we'd definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: DeeBrennan123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eurostars Domus Aurea in May of this year and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends. The hotel was perfect for our trip to Rome. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful- from the first person we saw at breakfast to the last night receptionist we saw when we came in at night. The breakfast was well worth getting up for- a great selection of cold and hot dishes and most importantly some strong Italian coffee provided the ideal start to the day! The location of the hotel is very convenient to Termini station (just a short walk) and all the sites of Rome are easily accessible. The rooms were lovely and the strong shower was great when you wanted to wash away a day of walking from your weary limbs! The air conditioning made all difference at night. All in all, a great hotel and one which we'd definitely return to on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: mthomas55
Reviews.Content: I work for a travel company and my husband and I travel constantly, at least every other week. This hotel has some of the worst service I have ever seen. The staff are not only unhelpful, they are also rude. Examples: - We were given the wrong passcode for the Wifi and called to the front desk. The desk agent said "I can't help you" and hung up. - For 3 of our 4 days, the breakfast room was dirty and lacked silverware. - The shower in our room leaked so terribly that it would cover the bathroom floor with water after a 5 minute shower - We called down for a taxi for the airport and were told it would be 5 minutes. Upon coming downstairs, we were told it would be at least another 10. 25 minutes after calling down, I went to the desk agent and he said he forgot we were waiting because he didn't seen us. He called another taxi. At this point I walked out and caught another cab myself. The desk agent ran after me into the street screaming that I can't do that and I had wasted his time, etc. My taxi driver and bystanders were horrified. I have never witnessed someone chasing me out of a hotel screaming. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, even if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service Grazie Tante Eurostars Domus Aurea!!”
Reviews.Author: icklesmeg
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed here for a week. It was very closely situated next to the Termini station (the main bus depot, rail and metro) which made it easier to travel round places. I would reccommend first time travellers to do the same, it just makes it easier to get to places. The hotel is in a safe area and there was two Bus services outside the street- Via Volturno. Very useful!! The Room was quaint and tight but me and my sister are petite anyways. The shower was very small too. Breakfast was nice, but the selection was limited if you woke up late. (P.S: If you consider staying here and if you are recommended to a restaurant called La Familgia, make sure you go to the correct one... there's two in the area and very easy to mix up cos it's the same family owned franchise in that area. The one that is bigger is better - it would be the one to your left as you walk out the entrance). The one on the other end is very... well dodgy, lets just say i couldn't choke my food down having 4 men staring at one end and another 2 at another... it was late and very scary) Sorry for rambling, the room was clean and housekeeping did a great job refreshing amenities. We had free internet access. Oh and the Espresso in the bar is quite nice too! Service was very very good. Especially this really super friendly girl called Flaminia. She was very patient and understanding :D The Manager was also a very lovely chap too he taught me "Grazie Tante". Would consider again. Grazie Tante Eurostars Domus Aurea!

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely book with them again!”
Reviews.Author: GinaWatsonHendry
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating and eager to please. The room was very clean and they provided an excellent breakfast! The food choices were abundant and DELICIOUS! Quiet location but conveniently close to popular attractions. Five stars from the Hendry family.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located. Small room.”
Reviews.Author: MarianoBUE
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is unbeatable. Only one block away from Termini. Nice staff (they speak many languages). Good prices is booked ahead. Great breakfast which avoids having lunch. What we did not like was that the room was way too small, but I imagine that has to do with the building being old. BEWARE: When arriving in Rome (Fiumiccino) do not take the pricey train (14 Euro), it's more convenient to take a Bus Shuttle for 8 Euro. It is located outside Terminal 3.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBlueBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small, but is Rome Termini, real Rome nevralgic centre, very handy for travellers and tourists.. the hotel is elegant and clean (a real must for me).. in this small place they are doing the best possible.. the bathroom is micro, but you cound cread your own in room steam room.. ehehe.. i was there for business trip and location is perfect to move around rome.. the best you can get is a rich breakfast in the roof terrace, to get the feeling of Rome from above.. When i was there hotels was run by a spanish company.. and you can tell when is the case: spanish run hotels have one of the best breakfast buffet. If you are looking for room this is not the place.. if you like a tidy place and you just need to sleep and have breakfast and want an easy commute from termini.. go for it!

Reviews.Title: “dont trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sneto
Reviews.Content: i had a reservation for this hotel from 08 october to 11 of october. The reservation was confirmed and they already have asker for my cc. for my surprised, when i arrived for the check in, the manager oh the hotel said that the hotel had a problem with the air conditioner and they had to send me to another hotel. I argued that air conditioner was a problem for me, and then they created another excused. what really happened was that the hotel had a overbooking ( there was a u2 show in rome) and they always works with this way, send people to other hotel, no matter how far is( in my case they sent us to vattican, the oldest and worst hotel that i've ever seen). So think twice when you reserve this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel close to termini”
Reviews.Author: philippostance
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights . 5 mins walk to termini station and metro. most of rooms are small. we stayed in room 209 which was twice the size of most of the rooms on the same floor. good breakfast with plenty of choice of food in the conservatory on the roof although a bit cramped. but overall a good choice for a rome city break.

Reviews.Title: “A FINE HOTEL CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: jimbohDublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a few days break, something we had never really done before so The Eurostars Domus Aurea just popped out of the pages of the Travel Agents catalogue. The hotel is situated rigt in the heart of Rome and close to all forms of transport, In fact as we looked out of our window (3rd. floor) we could see the main metro station and tour buses. the staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and no inquiry was too much for them to answer. Because we were on a budget we booked a basic double room which were on the small side but extremely clean and well kept. The Breakfast room is situated on the rooftop which gives you a panoramic view of the city. Breakfast was very nice with a few choices, but get there early if you want something hot, our usual time was 8am. We had decided on a five night stay which gave us plenty of time at our own leisure to see all we had hoped to see. We also booked the hop on - hop off tour bus 18 euros each for two days which initally helped us to get our heads around the location of all the historic sites(some are within walking distance of the hotel) after that it was second nature Why take a bus you ask? In August it is VERY hot and having left the hotel for our little exploration the heat became unbearable within ten minutes. Be wary of some of the guides who will charge you a small forune to escort you, and in the end you are rushed around the site and you may not see all you want. My wife and I bought two guide books with pictures and information included and spent a half day at athe Colosseum alone. So with a packed lunch and we did it all at our own pace. I would certainly go back to this hotel as it was quite adequate to all our needs. The only complaint is we had to leave at the end of our stay. Our highlight was The Sistine chapel - yes all of the paintings, sculptures were magnificent but this chapel took our breadth away. Coming in second - The Colosseum Wow !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ttkeith
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel my daughter and I stayed in as we toured through Italy. The hotel is very close to the Termini which was nice. However, there was little outside signage and we passed the hotel the first time. If you stay here be on the lookout for a small plaque on the wall....nothing big or obvious. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. Antonio immediately gave us a detailed map of the area showing us the best routes to tour all the sights. He also gave us a wonderful recommendation for a restaurant around the corner. Familia was a nice family owned restauarant with fresh food, good vino and very affordable. Our room was on the 1st floor and overlooked the main street. With the window open it was very noisy but the closed window kept out the street noise. We had two twin beds that were the most comfortable of all the hotels we had stayed previously. The room was small by US standards but was fine for us. There was not a dresser to put our clothes, just a small closet....but not enough hangers. Our bathroom was quite large and roomy. The shower could have easily been twice the size. It was about 3' square and had a vinyl shower curtain instead of a glass door. The breakfast was served on the roof and was probably the most ample of all the hotels we had stayed at. A nice selection of both European and American fare. I would say that the quality of the food was not as good (a lot of pre-packaged stuff) as other hotels but certainly a big variety. My biggest complaint here was that there was one coffee machine which only brewed 1 cup at a time. So basically there was a line for instant coffee. Overall....this was a nice hotel and met our needs. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, great breakfast, smal room”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Graca
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have been into Rome and we have stayed in Eurostar Domus Aurea Hotel. When we arrived the staff were very polite and useful. When we get to the room we saw that it was a little small but just to sleep it was ok. The room and the bathroom were extremelly clean. The view from the place where the breakfast is served is amazing, you can see a big part of the city. The breakfast is very good, it has a lot of choices and something different everyday. And the pies were very tasty (mmmmm). If you want to sent some time in Rome and don't spend much money, I surelly recommend this hotel. It was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, close to termini so easy access to everything.”
Reviews.Author: kathykels
Reviews.Content: Well first off, we did exactly what we were warned not to do.. we got a taxi from termini!!! We did our homework, so we knew the Termini was just 2 blocks from the hotel.....What we didn't realise was that where the train from the airport offloads, is quite some distance from the main area. We took the nearest exit and could not get our bearings, even with a map. There were roadworks preventing us from crossing the road and we had large cases...so we ended up taking a taxi which took us the scenic route and charged 18 euros! Later we realised our error. In retrospect, if we'd walked about 200 metres down the platform, we would have reached the main shopping area of the termini. Basically then all we needed do was wa lk out of the main doors, turn right and walk alongside the fence until we reached the road, then cross 2 small roads... 5 minutes to the hotel. We arrived hot and sticky, into a marble reception area , with a smiling, welcoming receptionist.. Our air conditioned room was most welcome. Granted, as said by others, rooms were not large, but it was adequately sized , with a compact marble bathroom with all the basic amenities, and spotlessly clean with stylish decor. I would say this hotel is wonderful value for money. Especially given it's location. The only down points I would state are...... The breakfast was usually cold - We arrived for breakfast between 8.30 and 9am, and apart from the first day, the scrambled egg was always cold. Maybe we needed to be a bit earlier off the mark eh. Have to say the coffee was wonderful.. yummmm. The only other fault I'd say , was relating to the tiny wardrobe. Too narrow to hang clothing properly.....but we managed by only hanging longer easily creased items, and leaving the remainder in out suitcase. Not a problem at all for the few days we were there. Staff were very freindly and pleasant. When I return to Rome ( tossed my coin in the Trevi Fountain), I shall stay there again. Brilliant Metro system. It's basically 2 lines which cross at Termini. It seems you can travel almost anywhere for 1 euro. ( For 1 euro you can travel for 75 minutes) From Termini, its 2 stops to Spagna for the Spanish steps. ( I think it's one stop for the Trevi fountain. 5 stops takes you to the Colleuseum. Most days our excursions began at Termini or at Republica stations. Purchase your 1 euro ticket from the ticket machine ( and make sure you get it time/ date stamped at the machine nearby or its a £5 euro fine). When you visit the Colluseum or Vatican don't be sucked in by people offering guided tours at top notch prices. All around the Vatican were tour guides. One British guide tried to persuade us to pay 35 euros each for the Vatican museum. The cost to do it alone, including an audio guide was something like 14 euros. Similarly at the colluseum, they offer a guided tour whereby you bypass the que, and the cost is more than double the cost to go it alone. As for bypassing the que... those who paid for a tour guide still qued but joined a fast moving que for those hiring the audio guide! We were in the same que, and pretty much walked straight in. TIP- go it alone at your own pace, but hire the audio guide..its a faster way in and costs only 4 euros extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the cost”
Reviews.Author: carebeast
Reviews.Content: It was not too far from the city center - the view from my room was lovely. It is so exciting to wake up and see Rome! As cheesy as that sounds, it is a feeling I will never forget! Everything is a short cabride away! The breakfast terrace, though closed in, offers lovely views too! I recommend this place if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianTraveller76
Reviews.Content: We had read some reviews about this hotel so was a bit wary as to what we were going to receive but I have to say for the price you could not want for more. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. Breakfast was lovely but I would say if you snooze you loose, we went at around 8 and had a great selection but from what we saw they don't replace items when they have ran out. The hotel was so close to Termini and the area did not feel scary like some others have said, so it was therefore a great base to travel around Rome on either the Metro or buses. Yes the room wasn't huge but it was very clean and comfortable, there was more than enough room for two of us without tripping over each other. However If you're spending time in your room you are missing out on such a beautiful city. All in all for the money you could not wish for a better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Eurstars Domus Aurea Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: jennyNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a short stay at this hotel. The hotel is ideally situated only approx. 1O minutes from the Termini bus and Railway Station. There were excellent restaurants nearby, also a very good take out lunch cafe just around the corner, with salads, sandwiches and lovely fruit salad, ideal for a picnic. We found the hotel reception staff very helpful and efficient. The rooms were a little on the small side (we stayed three nights at the start of our trip and had a twin room, and one night at the end and had a double room, and the twin room was considerably more spacious). Immaculate bathroom. Excellent breakfast served on a enclosed roof terrace. Would stay here again if ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not a good start ....”
Reviews.Author: TravelluverCoDown
Reviews.Content: Arriving late evening we only intended spending one night in the hotel and travel to Sorrento next morning. We were content to book something fairly basic - no point spending a lot. However we wanted a relaxing good night's sleep and to unwind. Unfortunately while our journey was pleasant with no problems when we presented ourselves to reception, within moments the tension started to rise dramatically. Our hotel vouchers did not match the booking held by the hotel --- we were 4 people, 2 double/twin rooms. They had us as 2 people, 2 single rooms; there were no double rooms left. Then we were told there would only be breakfast for 2 people, which became for no people after another staff member looked at the untidy bits of paper they held. As far as the hotel was concerned the paid for arrangements on our vouchers were not worth the paper they were written on - they had no interest in even examining them. We were sent to our rooms with no apology and told to discuss breakfast with the staff who would be on shift in the morning. The rooms were unbelievable - you had to walk sideways around the bed and sit at a most peculiar angle on the toilet. Needless to say we did get breakfast, but the holiday was off to an unsettling start.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: planatrip4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1night on our way back from our honeymoon on the amalfi coast because we had an extended layover. It served its purpose well since it was easy to get to and from the airport. the rooms were small, but very clean. if we were going back to rome, we would probably choose to stay in a different location since the area around is not the most scenic/romantic. However, for 75 euros, we thought this was a great hotel for our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: Mdanderson76
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the place was really really clean. A must for us because a gross bathroom can do me in! The room was decorated nicely...for larger individuals it could be cramped, but for average sized folks it's just right. The staff, eh, not rude by any means, but not exactly warm and cuddly. That was the only issue I had with the place. A good place to stay if you're city-hopping around Italy because you can easily roll your bags over to/from the train terminal in about 10 minutes without needing a cab...a lesson we learned the hard way when a cabbie grabbed us right off the train and told us it was a pretty long walk then proceeded to take us the LONG WAY to the hotel and charged us about $20.

Reviews.Title: “'' I would never recommend this Hotel''”
Reviews.Author: AllesandroUK
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights during our stay in Rome. 1. The Rooms were small however clean and had all the basic accessories that one needs 2 The Staff were the most rude on the Continent that I have ever expereinced - I am a Business Travel however this Hotel was for Leisure and I have never been spoke to in such an 'rude' and arrogant manner. 3. I had twisted my ankle it was pretty swollen and apparently there was no Ice available in the Hotel (38 Degrees during my stay) and no member of staff assisted me or were even bothered to help 4.'Smile' the Reception Staff did not smile, were arrogant, were in no shape helpful or went out of their way to help. 5. I was stopped on to occasions on the way back from an evening meal and asked if I was 'staying at the Hotel' My response was I wouldn't be walking in to my room if I wasn't staying here! If the Staff would work on Good Manners, the occassional smile, and be most helpful I am sure the Hotel would be a Joy to stay in. From my personal expereince I would 'Never' recommend this hotel to anyone based on my expereinces with the Staff and not the small rooms! 'Rome was beautiful........' UK

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Liam80
Reviews.Content: We found Eurostars Domus Aurea to be quite good value for money. The rooms were clean and modern as were the facilities. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was good being in one of the cleaner areas of Rome and only a few hundred meters from the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricardo_papa
Reviews.Content: I loved Eurostars Domus Aurea. Been there with my wife in June 2008. The hotel is very well located, three blocks away from Termini Station, the central station for bus, subway and train of Rome. Employees are very nice, beginning from reception. I needed orientation about the safe box and the employee came around very quick and efficiently. There are good, yet simple, restaurants around the area, as well many 'tabacchi' shops and a laundry for those who are away from home for many days. I also needed hot water for a tea and it was provided instantly. Observations: a) the room is very small, as well the wardrobe and bathroom (you can´t leave much clothes in it); b) roof terrace, where breakfast was served, had its top a little dirty; c) there are no blackout curtains to isolate light in the rooms. Anyway, it´s a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eurostars Domus Aurea, Rome”
Reviews.Author: paolov
Reviews.Content: I just came from my first trip to Italy and I stayed in Rome as my take-off point to the other cities. I booked Domus Aurea because of the proximity to the train station and was not disappointed - very convenient, prob just 3 - 4 blocks away. The area towards the hotel was well-lighted and busy, not scary at all as I thought it would be. The staff speak good English and are very helpful. The entire hotel looks recently renovated and the rooms and the lobby are very clean. The only problem, though, is the size of the rooms - probably the smallest hotel rooms I've ever seen. You can not lay out your luggage without it obstructing your way! If you have plenty of luggage, just leave the bulk at the train station. Overall, it was good value - for the price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “My First Review”
Reviews.Author: BenFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in September, 2007. The food was excellent and the hotel is well situated to travel easily around Rome. The staff were always hardworking, polite and courteous. The room was always kept clean and tidy. The only complaint I have is with the size of the room which was small - particularly the shower.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: clare3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated very near to the rail and bus station so is an excellent choice for easy access to Rome. The area is a little run down. There were a couple of drunks sleeping on the pavements but I never felt unsafe. The hotel rooms are small and the shower would be unsuitable for any larger customers. On the plus side the hotel was very clean and the breakfasts included an excellent range of food. The air conditioning was very effective and the rooms had shutters and heavy drapes so there was very little outside noise. If you just want a base to explore Rome at a very reasonable price this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: caroline077
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel online after reviewing mainly the location. This on its own was inaccurate, all distances suggested were in reality twice what was suggested. Our travels had been to over 15 different cities and included many many wonderful hotels, however, this one was an extreme disappointment. The staff were perhaps the most miserable and unhelpful we had come across. Such a depressing welcome to Italy. We had needed to cancel a first night stay because of travel difficulties ( which had occurred often before) and found then manager totally uncooperative, totally rude and insulting and more importantly totally un-negotiable which astounded us as seasoned travellers. The room was claustrophobic, noisy, hot ,basically as small as a laundry should be, and can I say that if you participate in breakfast, be prepared to partake in the most miserable, measly, stale offering that we encountered throughout Europe and the Meditteranean. Do yourselves a favour.. Shop elsewhere as this place is just not accomodating..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome way to start a European Adventure!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUCKY9293
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AWESOME!!!!!!! When my friend and I began looking for hotels for our European Vacation (a high school graduation gift which we did with our mothers) we had some fears about booking a hotel in Rome before our cruise. We had heard horror stories about no Air Conditioning and bad room conditions so we searched for a month straight and decided on this Hotel. BEST CHOICE EVER!!! This hotel was a great bang for your buck in a safe and great location! We stayed two nights and were taken care of perfectly! The staff was super friendly (especially the manager who was a blast!) and the rooms were spotless!!! Don't get excited rooms in Europe as a whole aren't big but at this hotel it was much bigger than I expected. There were no safes in the room but I didn't need one. I felt amazingly safe and at ease the enitre stay. In fact, my mother had lost one of her earrings which fell off at the bar, and as we came down to go out to eat, the man behind the front desk stopped her and gave it to her. The breakfast in the rooftop cafe was great as well. Great view of the skyline and pretty darn good food. Some tips for all those who stay at this hotel: *There is a great little restaurant and the street next to where the hotel is, great prices, delicious food. *BUY YOUR WINE AT GROCERY STORES!!!! Or any liquor for that matter! When you go into little shops you will pay twice as much for wine that is just as good as what you can buy in the grocery stores (which are not hard to find just ask in the hotel!). In fact my mother bought one bottle for 95 cents (euros). AGAIN CHOOSE THIS HOTEL YOU WONT BE SORRY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotbeare15
Reviews.Content: March 21-24 2007 - Having read the previous reviews, I was worried about staying at the Domus Aurea. It was a really nice little hotel. Ok, so the rooms aren't huge but we had 2 single beds which made a 6ft span, a chest of drawers, double wardrobe, desk and chair. We had room to move! The bathroom was very well decorated with all marble walls and floor. Stylish corner shower and handbasin, loo & bidet for soaking our tired feet! Nice big white fluffy towels too - changed every day. The room & bathroom were spotless. Breakfast on the 6th floor roof was terrific. It was in a glass conservatory with a great rooftop view. The choice was huge. 4 different breads, croissants, danish pastries, cakes, fruit flans, eggs, cheese, cold cuts of meat, cooked saugage, eggs & bacon, numerous jams, honey, choc spread, 5 or 6 fresh fruit, yoghurts - a really good stuff your face blow out! Hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the city. The hotel is about 150 metres from the bus & train terminus. There are 50 - 60 buses starting and ending there. A 3 day us & tube pass cost us 11 Euros. There are several local trattorias & bars within 100 metres of the hotel plus a few shops and little street market. I wouldn't hesitate to go back there and I would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geocaddy1
Reviews.Content: The was a decent hotel. It was a convienant location to Roma Termini station (about 4 blocks away). The lobby did smell of damp/mildew, but did not have a problem with my room. I had a single room, which by European standards was bigger than other single rooms i rented while in Italy. The staff was helpful. Breakfast had a large assortment. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the room size”
Reviews.Author: MICHelF
Reviews.Content: Hotel reception smelt of damp. Room 205 was the size of a single and should not have been sold as a double bedded room. The staff were friendly but the room sizes let the hotel down. Breakfast was not great but the view was good. Good location though but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Eurostars Domus Aurea Hotel Rome in May 2006 for 5 days. Although the rooms are a bit small, it did not matter. It was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. It is close to all amenties and attractions and the area is fairly safe. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast!!! I will definately stay at this hotel again...value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quidam
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome and stayed in the Domus Aurea for 5 nights. The staff were welcoming and friendly. On the first night they did not have the room that we had booked and put us in a tiny room with probably less than a foot each side of the bed. We had to manoeuvre our suitcases around the passage way in order to get into the bathroom! However, the next day, the staff were kind enough to move us into a bigger room. The beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. The breakfast had a good selection however the juice machine kept running short and resembled water once or twice. When we asked about using the Internet, we were told that the PC works off credit cards and it cost 15 euro an hour whereas the internet point a couple of yards down the road cost cents. The best thing about this hotel is the location as it is minutes from the Termini and all tourist attractions are within walking distance (about 20 mins to Colosseum, 20 mins to Trevi Fountain etc.). We were also around the corner from the La Famiglia Restaurant which served great food and wine, very reasonable prices and quick service!

Reviews.Title: “dismal”
Reviews.Author: traveldawg
Reviews.Content: After the positive reviews for this hotel, I was shocked by my experience there. I checked in to a beautiful lobby, thinking I had made a smart choice. But when I got to the room, I could tell it had no connection to the lobby. I had been travelling Europe for two months, so I was used to small rooms. This one was not only dark and dingy, but was way beyond small. It truly was just about a foot larger than the bed on each side. The bed linens were threadbare, but the room felt a little better when i opened the curtains. The bathroom seemed clean. I was travelling throughout Europe for a couple months and had to make sure that I booked hotels that had internet connections so that I could work. Domus Aurea's site emphasized in all caps that it had wifi service. When I couldn't find a connection I called the desk, only to be told that it wasn't working, but I might want to try the computer in their lobby. That one didn't have any connection either. The desk clerk sent me down the street to an internet point, where I proceeded to book another hotel, because I could not work without a connection to the net. I came back and checked out, figuring the sooner I vacated the room the better. The clerk knew why I was checking out, but insisted that he had to charge me for the entire time that I had booked. No compensation or consideration or even a reduced rate of any kind. Not even an apology that they couldnt offer what they advertised. I understand that I had made the reservation; though on the other hand, the hotel could not provide what I reserved. The lack of consideration or even any kind of apology at all hardly seems like a sign of good service. Four hotels later I ended up with a great room at a cheaper rate at XX Settembre Hotel - one of the positive suprises of my travels. I highly recommend investigating it if you are looking for a hotel in the range and location of the Domus Aurea. The Domus Aurea seems to be an okay hotel, but there are several other nicer ones for the same price in the area worth investigating if you're looking to be near the Termini area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a low-cost stay”
Reviews.Author: itinerantnomad
Reviews.Content: This property came up at quite a reasonable price compared to other properties in Rome. I was sceptical, so read the other earlier reviews and decided to go for it. I agree with the earlier reviewers. While my room was very small, it was clean. Breakfast on the covered roof terrace was good (cereal, cold meat, cheese, bread, hard boiled eggs, etc), though I really disliked the fact they had a NESCAFE coffee machine instead of real coffee! Ugh. I had just juice or water at breakfast, and went downstairs to a little cafe for my morning cappucino instead. I also learned quickly that Republicca station on Line A to the south and P Clinico station to the north on Line B, each only 5 minutes walk, were much nicer than the slightly grubby area around Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at Hotel Domus Aurea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a three-star hotel which was closer to the train station and at the same price as a two-star hotel we had been staying at. The breakfast was massive and the staff very welcoming. It was 79 euros per night including a huge buffet breakfast, tea, coffee, two types of yoghurt, 4 types of bread, bacon, parma ham, cold cut meat and cheeses, cereals, fruit, eggs, mini sausages. Served on a rooftop terrace. Rooms were med/small, mattress soft but old--could make out the location of individual springs, but no prob sleeping on it. The cheesy headboard and wardrobe were painted torquoise with "romanesque" wave pattern carved out. However, the bathroom was very contemporary with glass and stainless steel fixtures, marble sink-top and marble inlay floor as well as white marble walls. Shampoo, soap, showercap, shower cream, toothpaste and toothbrush, and two thick towels await you. It had good water pressure and the temperature was just right. it was a bit noisy just outside the room--staff always seemed to be vacuuming and we could hear the other guests coming and going. TV and minibar. Windows shut-out the sound from the street very effectively. Helpful staff let you leave excess luggage before or after our stay and didn't charge. They also went to great length to help us confirm our flight home. They also recommended an excellent restaurant with remarkable value for money, and gave us a business card for 10% off. Local small food store across street and up a block for days when you want to do a packed lunch. We bought a large sandwich for one euro to take on the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very convenient....close to major railway/bus and metro connections at Termini. And within walking distance to most of the historical sites in Rome. Small rooms, but excellent cleanliness and adequate facilities. Bathrooms were good. Staff, polite and friendly. Breakfast on the terrace, with good variety and eat as much as you like. Overall, excellent value and a good base for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: phunkybush
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for 5 nights this July. The hotel was small, clean and well presented. The staff, although quiet, were friendly and helpful when asked. The room is indeed small, although this was no problem to us, and the combination of marble and wood is pleasing on the eye. The bathroom was again small, but spotlessly clean. One particular highlight is the buffet breakfast, served on a partially covered roof terrace. The quality of the food provided is very good, including scrambled egg and bacon, and you can eat as much (or as little) as you like. Location-wise, the hotel is very close to the Termini railway station, the central bus station and the Metro. It is not the most pleasant of areas at night, but neither was it particularly threatening. There were some problems, but they were minimal - the tv didn't work after the first night, and the hot water supply was a bit erratic. Given the excellent value, these niggles were hardly important. If you want somewhere comfortable and simple to stay in Rome and arent too bothered about having lots of space, then I would strongly recommend the Domus Aurea

Reviews.Title: “Two Happy Visitors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 happy nights at the Domus Aurea. The location is perfect: a very short walk from the Termini station. The hotel is immaculately clean. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The room was quite pleasant and comfortable. Our bathroom was large and very nicely done in marble. Travelers need to know that the rooms, while very comfortable, are not large and luxurious. If they want that, they need to spend a whole lot more money elsewhere. The breakfast room on the top floor has a fine view of the city. And the breakfast served there is very good. [They do, however, need to find a better way of keeping their eggs hot.]

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights during half term. The hotel was in walking distance from the Termini station which is only a 11 Euro direct train ride from the airport and is therfore very convenient. The room was clean with a lovely marble bathroom, although no shower curtian meant we had our own ensuite swimming pool! The bed was the only criticism, as they were two singled pushed together and not the double we had requested. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide variety of breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, cereals etc and could not be faulted. If you are looking for a short break, which we were, then this hotel is excellent and in a good location for all the tourist attractions. However I would not like to spend a week here as the room and hotel are a little claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Domus Aurea. It is a lovely little place to stay and has been nicely done out. The staff were friendly. Our room, although small, was comfortable and tastefully decorated. If you want a large room though, ask for room 209! The hotel is in an ideal location, approx 2 mins walk from the main train and bus stations, and within easy walking distance of all the sights Rome has to offer. The rooftop breakfast room has a superb view, and the breakfast, which was included in the price was excellent. Plenty of choice to keep you going until lunch time. Extremely good value and well worth a stay if you are on a short trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not bad....”
Reviews.Author: bluewaters
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 3 nights at this hotel, the room is small, with a wardbrobe - OK if you are on a short break, the bathroom is lovely, although just a shower no bath, but lots of hot water - the room was very clean!! Not the best location for the sights, but great if you are getting the train from the airport. All in all an OK hotel for the price, breakfast was good, and the rooms, quiet and dark!! Staff could do with a dose of a happy pill - but were nice enough and helpful when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Moved out of Domus Aurea and found another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very small room..no drawers for clothes. Reception unhelpful and unfriendly. Television broken throughout whole hotel for the three days we were there. They advertise 100meters from station.I chose it because I was travelling with an arthritic person and that distance we could manage to walk. Distance is three times that over the worst pavements ever. Cases with wheels were a struggle over this terrain. Reception woman did not even look up for three minutes while we stood there. We had a struggle of a journey and we were so pleased to get there in the end. Not pleased for long though. They did not tell us that we had to use door -key -card entered into a slot in darkened room to get light. Laughed heartily when we struggled back to reception to say we had no lights in our room. Nice bathroom and good breakfast. But we were very miserable there. We left after three miserable days the and moved to Palladium Hotel..same price range and lovely to be in.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Domus Aurea
HotelInfo.Address: Via Volturno 30 - 32 - 34, 00185 Rome, Italy
